intro: Anemone alpina var. intermedia, commonly known as the Alpine anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, white to pinkish flowers with five petals, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
